clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Assess Body Fluid Homeostasis After Administration of ACT-132577 in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Two-way Crossover Study to Assess Body Fluid Homeostasis After Administration of ACT-132577 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical study will be conducted to evaluate the effect of ACT-132577 on fluid homeostasis in healthy subjects.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

other_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 up to End-of-Study (i.e. for at least 25 days)
other_outcome.description: Number of subjects with Adverse Events

other_outcome.time_frame: From Screening (Day -3) up to Follow-up (i.e. for at least 49 days)
other_outcome.description: Number of subjects with Serious Adverse Events

other_outcome.time_frame: At 0 h of Day 1, at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h and 10 h of Day 1 & Day 9
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline to each scheduled timepoint

other_outcome.measure: Fractional sodium excretion in 24 h urine samples [mmol per day]
other_outcome.time_frame: At 0 h of Day 1, at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h and 10 h of Day 1 & Day 9
other_outcome.description: Fractional excretion will be calculated as the clearance of sodium divided by the clearance of creatinine. Change from baseline to each scheduled timepoint

other_outcome.measure: Fractional lithium excretion in 24 h urine samples [mmol per day]
other_outcome.time_frame: At 0 h of Day 1, at 1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 6 h and 10 h of Day 1 & Day 9
other_outcome.description: Fractional excretion will be calculated as the clearance of lithium divided by the clearance of creatinine. Change from baseline to each scheduled timepoint

intervention.description: Formulated in capsules in 2 different strengths; 2 capsules per day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Healthy on the basis of medical history, physical examination, cardiovascular assessments and hematology, clinical chemistry, and urinalysis tests
- Body mass index between 20.0 and 25.0 kg/m2 (inclusive) at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any circumstances or conditions, which, in the opinion of the investigator, may affect full participation in the study or compliance with the protocol
